title: The Springfield Arch
body:
The Cinebar construction continued full-force this weekend, and here's the proof:



To separate the back half of the concession area (box office) from the front (Cinebar), dad decided to build an arched dividing wall. Step one was to build a continuing "joist" to attach the arches to. NOTE: I cut the arches all by myself!



Here's a shot from the back, exposing the sweet, sweet 2x6's.



Here's Nicole examining the pipes above the box office. NOTE: While Nicole was looking up, the backside of the arch miraculously cloned another piece.



SEE! Now the arch is double-sided, immediately making it twice as cool. Nicole is practicing her "pseudo-celebrity doesn't have time for photos" pose.



Here's an upskirt shot of the arch (NSFW!). More 2x6 hotness!



What's that? A solid Cedar beam? That wasn't there before! Wait a minute... what was there before? Oh yeah, a broken piece of wall. (*knock* *knock* *knock*) Hey! That's not solid... it's just boxed in! You lied to me, Dan. Damn you!



Once the arch was built, we had to do something about all that space above it. Dad wanted to frame it in and install a backlit window with the Moxie's logo painted across it. While I agree that the window would look really cool, we still need a place to stick our menu. What's that? Stick it where?!



So the space was framed in...



... and sheetrocked.



Here's a shot from the box office area. We're going to install a drop ceiling just above the arch, so you won't see anything higher up than that.



The final of piece of sheetrock was applied, and VOILA! The Cinebar is one step closer to completion.



To hide the broken, jagged pieces of wall that surrounded the vault, dad devised this little trick. He called it "cedar framing." Don't worry, everything's going to be painted over...



Here's a close-up of the fine woodworking craftsmanship. Dad cut that out with a jigsaw. I think I'm going to paint the cloud that throws stuff at you from Super Mario Brothers over the top.
author: Dan

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Was that the cloud's name? Piku? Justin knows all about that name... he owns piku.org.

comments.author: Nate
comments.body: I think it's Liko or something.

comments.author: Allison
comments.body: i play way too many video games -- it's lakitu

comments.author: Nate
comments.body:
Ah Lakitu...that little f***er was always giving me a hard time on level 3-3.

And level 6-1.

Lakitu works on several levels.

comments.author: Rachel
comments.body: Okay, I may be a little naive, but what does "NSFW" mean?

comments.author: Jamie
comments.body: Wow Dan that looks so goog.  I am amazed how far it has come since we were there last.  too cool!

comments.author: Jamie
comments.body:
Goog= good. Because goog = google which is great.

Oops! I am a math teacher, not a typing teacher. Oh yeah, I am certified in that also. Scary!

comments.author: brian of moore
comments.body: drop ceiling?.. are you going to hide stuff up there?  like a time capsule?  or use it to store cups and popcorn?  ... i think time capsule... the people of 2009 need to know what it was like in our time.. the music we listened too.. the movies we watched... alas... none of us will be around to tell them

comments.author: matt
comments.body: i will pay you $20 to sponsor the super mario cloud!  no joke.  i want to see that painted!!!
